description: doc: add a "New packages" section to the 1.1 release notes.

messages.text:
Hello adg@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

https://codereview.appspot.com/9344044/diff/5001/doc/go1.1.html File doc/go1.1.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/9344044/diff/5001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode708 doc/go1.1.html:708: Node to format a Go parser you can't format a parser. to format a Node from the go/parser package. https://codereview.appspot.com/9344044/diff/5001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode712 doc/go1.1.html:712: to format arbitrary Go source code. to reformat arbitrary Go source code into the standard format as provided by the go fmt command

https://codereview.appspot.com/9344044/diff/5001/doc/go1.1.html File doc/go1.1.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/9344044/diff/5001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode708 doc/go1.1.html:708: Node to format a Go parser On 2013/05/12 00:49:48, r wrote: > you can't format a parser. > > to format a Node from the go/parser package. Well, it's not "format a parser", it's "format a Go parser Node". This is a copy/paste of existing text in go1.1.html. https://codereview.appspot.com/9344044/diff/5001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode712 doc/go1.1.html:712: to format arbitrary Go source code. On 2013/05/12 00:49:48, r wrote: > to reformat arbitrary Go source code into the standard format as provided by the > go fmt command > > Done.

https://codereview.appspot.com/9344044/diff/10001/doc/go1.1.html File doc/go1.1.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/9344044/diff/10001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode706 doc/go1.1.html:706: a convenient way for a program to access the formatting capabilities of gofmt. the go fmt command (as used below) https://codereview.appspot.com/9344044/diff/10001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode721 doc/go1.1.html:721: The runtime/race package provides low-level facilities for data race detection. probably want to say it's internal to the race detector and not meant for users. in fact, since it has no exported symbols i don't think it's even necessary to document it here. it's just an internal piece of the runtime.

https://codereview.appspot.com/9344044/diff/10001/doc/go1.1.html File doc/go1.1.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/9344044/diff/10001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode706 doc/go1.1.html:706: a convenient way for a program to access the formatting capabilities of gofmt. On 2013/05/12 19:31:27, r wrote: > the go fmt command > > (as used below) Done. https://codereview.appspot.com/9344044/diff/10001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode721 doc/go1.1.html:721: The runtime/race package provides low-level facilities for data race detection. On 2013/05/12 19:31:27, r wrote: > probably want to say it's internal to the race detector and not meant for users. Some more words added. I'd like to keep it in this list, since it is a new package in the standard library, even if it doesn't export anything.

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=880991592ded ***

doc: add a "New packages" section to the 1.1 release notes.

R=adg, r
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/9344044

subject: code review 9344044: doc: add a "New packages" section to the 1.1 release notes.
